explanation: Article 368 of the Constitution deals with the powers of Parliament to amend the Constitution and its procedure. The Parliament of India is the supreme legislative body of the Republic of India. The Indian Parliament consists of the President, Lok Sabha (the Lower House), and the Rajya Sabha (Upper House).
